item.title: ‘It Was Chaos’: How an Ohio Youth Treatment Center Tried to Put an End to Rising Violence
item.description: A year after taking over Mohican Young Star Academy, new owners and leadership face questions from workers, police and neighbors about its direction.

item.title: Tree Hanging Death at Delta State University Raises Dread of Mississippi’s Past Lynchings
item.description: A Black freshman’s apparent suicide on campus is one of at least nine Black men who have been found hanging from trees since 2000.

item.title: A Leading Prison Journalist Upends Our Obsession With True Crime
item.description: John J. Lennon tells Bill Keller that he “wanted to tell a different story about the guilty” in his new book.

item.title: Trump Says Federal Deployments Make Cities Safer. Local Officials Disagree.
item.description: In Chicago, Memphis and elsewhere, residents allege a surge of federal agents and military troops is making it harder to police and prosecute crime.

item.title: Who Should Pay Victims of Police Misconduct? Only the Officers, Some Cities Say.
item.description: Denver, Minneapolis and other cities want to avoid paying large sums owed to victims of some types of misconduct. But will the officers pay up?
